Choice C: Munit Haec et Altera Vincit (One Defends and the Other Conquers)
Correct Answer: A Mari Usque Ad Mare (From Sea to Sea)

Question: Which Canadian province is known for its polar bear population?
Canada operates under a parliamentary democracy.
The Prime Minister of Canada is elected directly by the citizens.
The Governor General of Canada is appointed by the Prime Minister.
The Canadian Parliament consists of the House of Commons and the Senate.
Members of Parliament (MPs) are elected to represent provinces in the Senate.
The Senate in Canada is a fully elected body.
The Prime Minister must be a member of the House of Commons.
The Lieutenant Governors of provinces are appointed by the federal government.
Provincial governments in Canada have authority over education and healthcare.
The Queen of Canada has executive authority over the government.
Cabinet ministers in Canada are appointed by the Governor General.
The Supreme Court of Canada has the authority to strike down laws deemed unconstitutional.
Provincial governments in Canada can create their own laws, known as statutes.
The Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms applies only to federal laws.
Referendums in Canada are legally binding and can change federal laws.
Canada's political parties play a significant role in shaping government policies.
The Governor General has the authority to dissolve Parliament and call for new elections.
The Official Languages Act of Canada guarantees equal status for English and French in federal institutions.
The Canadian electoral system uses a proportional representation method.
Canada has a system of checks and balances to prevent concentration of power in one branch of government.
